entry.title: The Public Telecommunication System Designation (Cablevision Communications Company of Hertfordshire Limited) (East Hertfordshire) Order 1991
entry.summary: The Secretary of State granted to Cablevision Communications Company of Hertfordshire Limited a licence on 11th January 1991 under section 7 of the Telecommunications Act 1984 to run the telecommunication systems specified in Annex A to that licence, in east Hertfordshire. A copy of the licence was laid before Parliament on 25th February 1991. This Order designates those telecommunication systems as public telecommunication systems. Consequently, by virtue of section 9(3) of that Act, Cablevision Communications Company of Hertfordshire Limited will be a public telecommunications operator in respect of its East Hertfordshire public telecommunication systems when the Order comes into force on 25th March 1991.

entry.title: The Berkshire, Buckinghamshire, Hampshire, Oxfordshire and Surrey (County Boundaries) Order 1991

category.term: LOCAL GOVERNMENT, ENGLAND AND WALES;CHANGES IN LOCAL GOVERNMENT AREAS

entry.title: The Fresh Meat Export (Hygiene and Inspection) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 1991
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Fresh Meat Export (Hygiene and Inspection) (Scotland) Regulations 1987 ("the principal Regulations) to take account of certain provisions of Council Directive 88/288/EEC (OJ No. L124,18.5.88, p.28) which further amends Council Directive 64/433/EEC (OJ No. 121, 29.7.64, p.2012/64) on health problems effecting intra-Community trade in fresh meat.

entry.title: The Social Fund Cold Weather Payments (General) Amendment Regulations 1991
The Community Charges and Non-Domestic Rating (Miscellaneous Provisions) (England) Regulations 1991
entry.summary: These Regulations are connected with orders made under Part IV of the Local Government Act 1972 (“boundary orders”). They extend only to England.

entry.title: The Local Government Finance (Miscellaneous Provisions) (England) Order 1991
The Alkali, & c. Works Order (Northern Ireland) 1991
entry.summary: The discharge of certain noxious or offensive gases from certain types of works is subject to control under the Alkali, and c. Works Regulation Act 1906 (“the Act of 1906”). Article 25(9) of the Clean Air (Northern Ireland) Order 1981 empowers the Department to make orders amending or extending both the list of gases and the list of works in the Act of 1906. The existing list of such gases is set out in section 27(1) of that Act, as extended and amended by the Alkali, and c. Works Order (Northern Ireland) 1987, and the existing list of works is set out in the First Schedule to that Act, also as extended and amended by that order. This order further extends and amends both these lists, and revokes the order of 1987.

entry.title: The Industrial Training (Offshore Petroleum Board) (Revocation) Order 1991
The Personal Community Charge (Reductions) (England) Regulations 1991
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for the reduction in certain cases of the amount that a person is liable to pay by way of personal community charge.

entry.title: The Public Telecommunication System Designation (Cablevision (Scotland) plc) (Edinburgh) Order 1991
entry.summary: The Secretary of State granted to Cablevision (Scotland) plc on 20th December 1990 a licence under section 7 of the Telecommunications Act 1984 to run the telecommunication systems specified in Annex A to that licence, in the Edinburgh area. A copy of the licence was laid before Parliament on 18th February 1991. This Order designates those telecommunication systems as public telecommunication systems. Consequently, by virtue of section 9 of that Act, Cablevision (Scotland) plc will be a public telecommunications operator when the Order comes into force on 18th March 1991.
